sp_widget.name: Building Cabling Description
sp_widget.template:
Inside Building Cabling provides a horizontal, unshielded, twisted-pair copper cabling infrastructure inside buildings to connect end user devices or utility infrastructure such as wireless access points, televisions, or cameras to Local Area Network switches.
Outside Building Cabling provides for the use of GRCâ€™s underground cabling infrastructure which connects devices between buildings. There are two primary types of outside building cabling: high-count copper cabling, which provides connectivity for some telephones and alarms systems; and fiber optic cables which provide physical connectivity for a multitude of IT services including Local Area Network and Streaming and Video Playback.
